p: Level (4) comprises therapeutic behaviors in which only sick individuals are expected to consume pharmacologically active substances from plants. These food items would not be expected to be in the animals’ regular diet, so they lack nutritional value. Moreover, these compounds would probably be more potent than preventive ones, and consequently, would carry a greater risk of negative side effects. This therapeutic behavior requires some level of awareness of wellness and discomfort, and the ability to respond with behaviors that bring about positive change in one’s condition [ 19, 20].
